titles.title: To amend the Mineral Leasing Act to increase the maximum acreage of Federal leases for sodium that may be held by an entity in any one State, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.
Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-469.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 268.

action.text: Mr. Hansen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3063.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Forests and Public Land Management. Hearings held.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 106-270.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 500.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 10/13/1999--Introduced. Amends the Mineral Leasing Act to double the maximum acreage of Federal leases for sodium (trona) that may be held by an entity in any one State.
